definition: private enterprise/abbr. of 私營企業|私营企业[si1 ying2 qi3 ye4]
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]

sentences.english: But I was under the impression that private-sector jobs paid better.
sentences.chinese: 但是我印象中私企的薪水更高。

sentences.english: Ultimately both public and private entities will have to work together. And soon.
sentences.chinese: 最終，公衆將和私企協作共贏，而這很快會成爲現實。

sentences.english: The Baoshan Steel Group, a famous SOE, acquired private Ninbo Steel.
sentences.chinese: 寶鋼集團，一個有名的國企，收購了私企寧波鋼鐵。

sentences.english: The theme park is funded by private enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 這個主題樂園是由私企投資建設的。

sentences.english: Many new graduates who work for private companies face similar problems.
sentences.chinese: 許多在私企事變的應屆結業生面對着相似的題目。

definition: state enterprise/(Tw) abbr. for 國際企業管理|国际企业管理, international business management (as a subject of study)
foreign enterprise/company established in mainland China with direct investment from foreign entities or from investors in Taiwan, Macao or Hong Kong/abbr. for 外資企業|外资企业
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
government (viewed as an organization)/institutions of government/government office
abbr. for 外商獨資企業|外商独资企业[wai4 shang1 du2 zi1 qi3 ye4]
centrally-managed state-owned enterprise (PRC), abbr. for 中央企業|中央企业[zhong1 yang1 qi3 ye4]
